Erik Wilde (@dret): Platform Economy:
The Short Game and the Long Game

(2) Summary

API platforms are all the rage, and everybody wants to build a platform. However, often the communications on the business side focus on different aspects of a platform than they do on the IT side. In this presentation, we look at the superficial differences of platforms as they are referred to in the business and IT space, but more importantly, we also look at the deep underlying commonalities. Using these commonalities, we then analyze the economics of a platform that can justify the necessary investments. We identify the "platform short game" and the "platform long game", which allow to better understand how investment into a platform can yield quick results, but also how it can drive sustainable growth.

From Linear to Platforms Erik Wilde (@dret): Platform Economy:
The Short Game and the Long Game

(8) Change is the new Normal

  • Organizations realize that they need to become better at changing
  • Start with analyzing current opportunities and risks
    • Grow [Short Game: Grow the Platform (1)] the ability to use existing assets and create new experiences
    • Evolve [Long Game: Evolve the Platform (1)] the business to more easily embrace new models
  • Showing a coherent path to become better and faster at changing
    • The short game [Short Game: Grow the Platform (1)] helps with improving revenue and reducing risk
    • The long game [Long Game: Evolve the Platform (1)] helps with supporting innovation
  • Creating results by aligning IT and business
    • There is no magical piece of technology to transform the organization
    • There are known patterns how to grow and evolve your organization


From Linear to Platforms Erik Wilde (@dret): Platform Economy:
The Short Game and the Long Game

(9) Linear Business



From Linear to Platforms Erik Wilde (@dret): Platform Economy:
The Short Game and the Long Game

(10) Platform: A Definition [https://www.modernmonopolies.com/]

  • What a platform is:
    • Generating value by facilitating exchanges/interactions between groups
    • Creating networks of users and resources that can be accessed on-demand
    • Using the network effect to grow communities and markets
    • Creating value by reducing transaction costs and/or by externalizing innovation
  • What a platform is not:
    • It is not just technology, it is the business model enabled by technology
    • It is not a linear business model with unidirectional value chains
    • It is not (completely) owning the means of production


From Linear to Platforms Erik Wilde (@dret): Platform Economy:
The Short Game and the Long Game

(11) The Platform Money Press



From Linear to Platforms Erik Wilde (@dret): Platform Economy:
The Short Game and the Long Game

(12) Tech & Biz = Platform

  • Platforms are what enable organization to create and deliver value
  • Technology can be both limiting and enabling
    • Limiting when creation/delivery seems to be too slow/costly
    • Enabling when digitalization opens new opportunities
  • Business can be both limiting and enabling
    • Limiting when business demands are not aligned with technology
    • Enabling when technology is used to create/deliver value faster
  • Any platform must make sure to align technology and business


From Linear to Platforms Erik Wilde (@dret): Platform Economy:
The Short Game and the Long Game

(13) Platforming: Building Products with a Plan

Your Starting Point Erik Wilde (@dret): Platform Economy:
The Short Game and the Long Game

(15) Your Current Platform

  • Why things are being built
    • Consumer focus and improving their experience
    • Innovation focus and the ability to design/build/test/fail effectively
  • What you are building on
    • Foundational resources that serve as basic building blocks
    • Existing capabilities that can be reused in new value chains
  • How building things is working
    • Design and build support (getting from idea to implementation)
    • Deployment and runtime support (getting from implementation to operation)


Your Starting Point Erik Wilde (@dret): Platform Economy:
The Short Game and the Long Game

(16) Platform Paralysis

  • Tech and Biz sometimes talk about platforms with a different focus
    • The Tech view is focused on a technical set of capabilities
    • The Biz view is focused on creating value by co-creation
  • Platform success critically depends on aligning both views
    • Tech has to extend the focus to supporting value creation
    • Biz has to focus on grounding co-creation on the platform
  • Define and align the goals and elements of the platform for all parties


Short Game: Grow the Platform

Outline (Short Game: Grow the Platform)

  1. Introduction [3]
  2. From Linear to Platforms [6]

Short Game: Grow the Platform Erik Wilde (@dret): Platform Economy:
The Short Game and the Long Game

(18) Growing the Foundation

  • API First [https://www.apiscene.io/api-business-models/api-first-the-essence-of-digital-transformation/] means to embrace APIs as the organization's business language
  • API First means making all assets/services available as APIs
    1. Expose existing/new assets and capabilities to the platform
    2. Add existing/new experiences to the platform
  • API First builds on the network effect [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Network_effect] of organizational capabilities
    1. Adding APIs as a way to support value co-creation


Short Game: Grow the Platform Erik Wilde (@dret): Platform Economy:
The Short Game and the Long Game

(19) Unlock Existing Value: Open Everything



Long Game: Evolve the Platform

Long Game: Evolve the Platform Erik Wilde (@dret): Platform Economy:
The Short Game and the Long Game

(21) The Platform Mindset

  • Platform business models thrive on growing and evolving
    • Growth is enabled by allowing more transactions to happen
    • Evolution is happening by investing in areas that drive growth
  • Many organizations are looking at hybrid platform models
    • Part of the value is traditional linear business (value created internally)
    • Part of the value is platform business (value co-created with others)
    • The platform part can be differentiating and harder to replicate
    • Cultivating a platform mindset can increase revenue and decrease risk


Long Game: Evolve the Platform Erik Wilde (@dret): Platform Economy:
The Short Game and the Long Game

(22) Platform Evolution

  1. Establish new ways of value co-creation
  2. Establish new ways of delivering experiences to consumers
  3. Adapt new ways how value is created and exposed internally


Long Game: Evolve the Platform Erik Wilde (@dret): Platform Economy:
The Short Game and the Long Game

(23) Evolve Value Creation: Own Your Platform



Long Game: Evolve the Platform Erik Wilde (@dret): Platform Economy:
The Short Game and the Long Game

(24) The Rule of Two

  • Don't platform yourself into one corner
  • Be open to evolve the platform when necessary
    • Accommodate new API Styles [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bWFXGHXo_pY]
    • Support new API design tools
    • Add APIs using different management infrastructure
    • Add new ways of low-code/no-code orchestration tooling
  • For each good practice think about what it means to change it
    • It's good to have support for (current) good practices
    • It's at least as good to be able to switch to a different good practice


Conclusions

Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): Platform Economy:
The Short Game and the Long Game

(26) Platforming Done Right

  • Becoming more platform-y makes sense for every organization
  • Open everything for the short game of growing the platform
  • Have an Open platform for the long game of evolving the platform


Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): Platform Economy:
The Short Game and the Long Game
